thread.title: Ex-Barcelona ace Pinto becomes Hollywood star and ‘will be in the next Fast and the Furious movie’
thread.title_full: Ex-Barcelona ace Pinto becomes Hollywood star and ‘will be in the next Fast and the Furious movie’

author: gstonehouse
title: Ex-Barcelona ace Pinto becomes Hollywood star and ‘will be in the next Fast and the Furious movie’
text:
Comments FORMER Barcelona goalkeeper Jose Manuel Pinto is swapping the football pitch for Hollywood’s silver screen. 
The 41-year-old is now a successful musician and record producer, and one of his tracks will be used in the new Fast and Furious 8 film. EMPICS Sport 4 Former Barcelona keeper Pinto is set to feature in the new The Fast and Furious 8 movie 
Going under his musical alter ego of Wahin, his track Havana will be number 13 on The Fate of the Furious movie album. 
Keep up to date with ALL the football gossip and transfers on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And it’s not the first time that Pinto has been involved in the big screen. 
His Papi, Papi song was included in the movie Ride Along 2, which starred Ice Cube and Kevin Hart. 
Pinto is proving to be quite the hit in the music world since his retirement from the game in 2014. 
He also won the Andalusian, which is a Latin Grammy, last November after producing a track in his studios in El Puerto de Santa Maria. 
The Spanish stopper began his career with Real Betis before joining Celta Vigo in 1998. 
After spending a decade there, he was snapped up by Barcelona and made 31 appearances in La Liga . AP:Associated Press Pinto is a successful musician and record producer News Group Newspapers Ltd Pinto spent eight years at Barcelona but was mainly understudy to Victor Valdes Getty Images He was part of the Champions League winning squad in 2011 
Pinto acted as back-up for now Middlesbrough No1 Victor Valdes. 
He won two Champions League medals while at the Nou Camp, as well as four league titles and the Fifa Club World Cup. Pep Guardiola is sad to hear of Barcelona manager Luis Enrique’s resignation
